meanings.definition: Extremely fussy or particular about details
meanings.sent1: She is so finickin about her outfits, always making sure every accessory matches perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The artist was finickin about the colors he used, spending hours choosing the exact shades for his painting.
meanings.sent3: Even the finickin cat refused to eat the food if it wasn't served in its favorite bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her finickin nature when it comes to cleanliness puts even the tidiest person to shame.
meanings.sent5: The finickin old man would spend hours arranging his bookshelf, ensuring each book was perfectly aligned.

meanings.definition: Showing or requiring great attention to detail
meanings.sent1: The architect's finickin drawings included every tiny measurement needed for the construction.
meanings.sent2: The detective's finickin investigation uncovered the smallest clues that led to solving the case.
meanings.sent3: The finickin chef meticulously plated each dish, turning cooking into an art form.
meanings.sent4: Her finickin eye for design transformed the plain room into a stylish and elegant space.
meanings.sent5: The finickin tailor ensured every stitch in the dress was perfect, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: She was so finickin about the font style in the presentation, spending hours debating between two similar fonts.
meanings.sent2: The boss was finickin about the office layout, rearranging desks multiple times to find the 'perfect' setup.
meanings.sent3: The finickin neighbor complained about the angle of the garden gnome, claiming it ruined the entire street's aesthetic.
meanings.sent4: His finickin attitude towards grammar made him the go-to person for proofreading important documents.
meanings.sent5: The finickin student insisted on rewriting the essay multiple times, obsessing over minor punctuation errors.
